column4: Can someone help me out real quick. I have all the restricted drivers installed for playing DVD's but when I start to play a DVD it seems like my computer freezes up and won't play
I have never been able to get a dvd to play
have you installed dvdcss2 from the Mediabuntu repo?
Don't think so, never heard of it
Where do i get dvdcss2
see https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Medibuntu for details, good luck
Ok now it plays for a little while without freezing but I then get "An error occured - Failed to connect stream: OK"
did you install libdvdcss2?
Yes
But I think the problem has to do with my fstab configuration since I don't see my second DVD player in it
do you have "mplayer" installed on your system?  if so try "mplayer dvd://1" -- nothing to do with fstab for dvd playback really, dvd's aren't really mounted to play them.
Can't find it
It doesn't seem to find my DVD in my second DVD player only in my first
libdvdcss2??? what can't you find?
Its not reconizing the DVD in my dvd player
so you can play dvds in one drive and not the other???  just trying to get some clarification.
correct

OK the problem is that /dev/dvd is a pointer to a specific drive if you do "ls -l /dev/dvd" it will show you which physical drive it's pointing too.  but if you can play in one drive - i'm done.  good luck man.
how do i point it to the other drive
sorry man i'm done, someone else might help with that.
thanks for your help :D
